main event: A long shaft-shaped silver object was observed in Marshall, Texas on October 10, 1955.
interesting points: The object had no visible vapor trail,It was estimated to be flying at an altitude of 35,000 to 42,000 feet,The object's flight pattern was described as very erratic,The sighting lasted for 1-2 minutes,The object's visibility was lost during the observation.
witness description: phone report, insufficient data for evaluation
